verses.verse: A psalm. A song for the dedication of the temple. Of David.
I will exalt you, O LORD, for you have raised me out of the depths[b] and have not let my enemies exult over me.
O LORD, my God, I called to you and you healed me.[c]
O LORD, you lifted me up from the netherworld;[d] you saved me from sinking into the pit.
Sing praise to the LORD, O you his saints;[e] give thanks to his holy name.
For his anger lasts for only a moment, while his goodwill endures for a lifetime. Weeping may last throughout the night,[f] but at daybreak there is rejoicing.
In time of good fortune, I said, “Nothing can ever sway me.”[g]
O LORD, in your goodness you established me as an impregnable mountain; however, when you hid your face, I was filled with terror.
[h]To you, O LORD, I cried out, and I implored my God for mercy:
“What advantage would my death provide if I descend into the pit? Can the dust praise you? Can it proclaim your faithfulness?
Listen, O LORD, and have mercy on me; O LORD, be my helper.”
You have turned my mourning into dancing; you have taken away my sackcloth[i] and clothed me with joy.
